physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with hyperkalemia and progressive weakness. Elevated serum potassium (8.9 mmol/L), BUN (6.8 mmol/L), and creatinine (210 mmol/L).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: BUN and creatinine decreased post-treatment to 4.2 mmol/L (25 mg/dL) and 130 mmol/L (1.5 mg/dL), respectively, and potassium to 4.5 mmol/L.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Renal ultrasound showed right kidney at 8.7 cm and left kidney at 10.5 cm in length.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 58 years of age, BUN and creatinine levels had worsened to 12 mmol/L (70 mg/dL) and 850 mmol/L (9.6 mg/dL), respectively.
